text:
Hi, I noticed a very minor typo on a DataFrames.jl docstring:
```help?> leftjoin
search: leftjoin

  leftjoin(df1, df2; on, makeunique=false, indicator=nothing, validate=(false, false),
           renamecols=(identity => identity), matchmissing=:error)


  Perform a left join of twodata frame objects and return a DataFrame containing
  the result. A left join includes all rows from df1.

  The order of rows in the result is undefined and may change in the future
  releases.```
The typo is "twodata frames" (instead of "two data frames").

What is the preferred protocol here? Is pointing it out enough? PR seems like overkill.

elements.text: Hi, I noticed a very minor typo on a DataFrames.jl docstring:

  leftjoin(df1, df2; on, makeunique=false, indicator=nothing, validate=(false, false),
           renamecols=(identity => identity), matchmissing=:error)


  Perform a left join of twodata frame objects and return a DataFrame containing
  the result. A left join includes all rows from df1.

  The order of rows in the result is undefined and may change in the future
  releases.

The typo is "twodata frames" (instead of "two data frames").

What is the preferred protocol here? Is pointing it out enough? PR seems like overkill.

text: thank you for reporting. could you please point to me where the typo is exactly? Thank you.

elements.text: thank you for reporting. could you please point to me where the typo is exactly? Thank you.

text: Sorry, I just edited my comment: first line, first paragraph: "twodata frames" => "two data frames"

elements.text: Sorry, I just edited my comment: first line, first paragraph: "twodata frames" => "two data frames"

text: I would also want to know what's the right protocol. Just in case :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: I would also want to know what's the right protocol. Just in case

text: Someone has to go into the source file, edit the docstring, make a PR and then it has to be merged. Informing about the issue is useful but if it is a trivial fix it is often more efficient to skip all the intermediate steps and make a PR straight away.

elements.text: Someone has to go into the source file, edit the docstring, make a PR and then it has to be merged. Informing about the issue is useful but if it is a trivial fix it is often more efficient to skip all the intermediate steps and make a PR straight away.

text: Making a PR is preferable. You can edit the file on GitHub and automatically open a PR

elements.text: Making a PR is preferable. You can edit the file on GitHub and automatically open a PR

text: I do not need to be informed here as I get a notification if someone opens a PR anyway.

elements.text: I do not need to be informed here as I get a notification if someone opens a PR anyway.

text: On the other hand if someone wants to propose a complex change it is better to open an issue on GitHub to discuss it before spending time on making a PR. We prefer to make complex PRs when we have a consensus on the design in DataFrames.jl
